intro: Lueheopsis duckeana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
